title: Enumerations
snippet: Define enumerated types with named values
description: Enumerations define a type with a fixed set of named constant values. While BPL doesn't have a dedicated enum keyword, you can emulate enums using const declarations or type aliases. Enumerations improve code readability by replacing magic numbers with descriptive names. They're useful for state machines, option sets, error codes, and any domain with a limited set of distinct values. Unlike some languages, BPL enums are not type-safe - they're just integer constants. Use naming conventions (PREFIX_VALUE) to group related constants. This example demonstrates enumeration patterns, switch statements with enums, and state management.
